author: ansible
code:
import parser
import sys


def main():
    status = 0

    for path in sys.argv[1:] or sys.stdin.read().splitlines():
        with open(path, 'r') as source_fd:
            source = source_fd.read()

        try:
            parser.suite(source)
        except SyntaxError:
            ex_type, ex, ex_traceback = sys.exc_info()
            status = 1
            message = ex.text.splitlines()[0].strip()
            sys.stdout.write("%s:%d:%d: SyntaxError: %s\n" % (path, ex.lineno, ex.offset, message))
            sys.stdout.flush()

    sys.exit(status)


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

description: Ansible is a radically simple IT automation platform that makes your applications and systems easier to deploy. Avoid writing scripts or custom code to deploy and update your applications— automate in a language that approaches plain English, using SSH, with no agents to install on remote systems.
